nodes.bodyText: It's fine to do this, but I think soon, we should remove all of these assertions. If the roles/privileges weren't correctly written out, that "bootstrap" would fail and none of the tests would run. So these assertions are redundant and not adding any value. Fine to keep them for now, I'll look into removing all of them soon.
Shouldn't you be able to do this without the "data-hub-developer" role, since this is an HC-specific capability?
Yes. It should. The any-uri, any-collection privileges should be added to hub-central-saved-query-writer.
I think hub-central-saved-query-writer just needs to inherit data-hub-common then, right @ryanjdew ?
data-hub-common-writer has the any-uri and unprotected-collections privileges. Should I extend that role?
Yes, I think that's the way to go.

I don't think we want these assertions here. Instead, what we care about is that the EntitySearchController endpoints are secured correctly. Those should have @secure("ROLE_manageSavedQuery") on them. You can then more effectively test the logic below by trying to hit the endpoints in a subclass of AbstractMvcTest as a user with that the saved-query roles, and without them.
No need to change, but you can do this in one method - loginAsTestUserWithRoles.
There's a helper method in AbstractMvcTest to make this a little easier, and it guarantees that the user's authenticated HttpSession is used - verifyRequestIsForbidden. Please use this instead.

Why is rest-writer needed here? Saved queries are written via Data Services. I don't think this is needed.
Any I missed why data-hub-common-writer didn't work?
